Learn

PLAN A:

Give extra fluid(as much as child will take,

Continue feeding,

Advise the parent when to return

PLAN B:

Give ORS in clinic during the first 4 hours.

Show the mother how to give ORS,

Reasses after 4 hours

Follow PLAN A

PLAN C
start
↓

Is the child lethargic or unconscious?

Does the child have sunken eyes

Is the child unable to drink or drinking poorly?

Does the skin pinch go back very slowly(>2 seconds)

Yes to at least 2
No to at least 3
↓

Is the child restless or irritable?

Does the child have sunken eyes?

Is the child drinking eagerly or thirsty

Does the skin pinch go back very slowly(> 2 seconds)

Yes to at least 2
No to at least 3
↓

Classification:

Severe Dehydration

↓

Classification:

Some Dehydration

↓

Classification:

No Dehydration

↓

Treat Some Dehydration

Follow Plan A

advise the mother to continue breasfeeding/feeding,

give zinc for 2 weeks,

follow up in 2 days

advise the mother when to return immediately.

↓

Treat No Dehydration

Follow Plan A

advise the mother when to return immediately.

give zinc for 2 weeks,

follow up in 5 days, if the child is not improving

↓

Continue

↓

Has the child had diarrhoea

for longer than 14 days?

Has the child been losing weight?

Yes to both
No to either
↓

Classification:

Severe Persistent Diarrhoea

↓

Treat Severe Persistent Diarrhoea:

Follow Plan C,

refer URGENTLY

give ORS on the way to urgent care.

give additional does of vitamin A.

↓

Continue with your evalution

↓

Is there blood in child's stool?

Is the child older than 1 year?

Yes to both
No to either
↓

Classification:

Severe Dysentery

↓

Treat Severe Dysentery

Refer URGENTLY

↓
